arm_group.description: Approximately 12 hours of light on and 12 hours of light off.

brief_summary.textblock:
Infants are exposed to either continuous bright light continuous near darkness or
      unstructured combination of the two. The investigators primary objective is to determine the
      effectiveness cycled light and near darkness on growth in preterm infants.

clinical_study.brief_title: Compare of Effectiveness Cycled Light or Near Darkness on Growth Parameters in Preterm Infants
clinical_study.condition: Compare of Effectiveness Cycled Light and Near Darkness on Growth in Preterm Infants

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  <32 gestational weeks preterm infants

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Major congenital anomaly

          -  Small for gestation age

          -  Grade III-IV intracranial hemorrhage

study_pop.textblock: Preterm infant (<32 gestational weeks) were enrolled in this study.

intervention.description: We covered the incubator with blanket  for darkness approximately 12 hours.
We covered the incubator with blanket all days.

facility.name: Zekai Tahir Burak Maternity Teaching Hospital

primary_outcome.description: We recorded infants' weight, height and head circumference measures on day 14, corrected 3 and 6 months.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Zekai Tahir Burak Maternity and Teaching Hospital
responsible_party.investigator_title: Zekai Tahir Burak Maternity and Teaching Hospital

secondary_outcome.description: We evaluated full enteral feeding time between two groups.
We evaluated duration of supplemental oxygen, nasal continuous positive airway pressure (CPAP) and mechanical ventilation for each groups.

clinical_study.source: Zekai Tahir Burak Maternity and Teaching Hospital

lead_sponsor.agency: Zekai Tahir Burak Maternity and Teaching Hospital

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
